content: Yes, Allende's skill in developing characters is noteworthy, and it is evident in The House of the Spirits as well. Despite the magical elements in the story, the characters are multi-dimensional and relatable. Their relationships, too, are complex and nuanced, adding to the emotional impact of the story. Throughout the novel, the characters' relationships ebb and flow, and the reader is compelled to care about their lives, their joys and sorrows, and their struggles. The magical elements are used to amplify the emotional impact of the character relationships rather than detract from them, resulting in a story that is both enchanting and deeply moving. The result is a story that feels grounded in reality but imbued with a hint of magic that makes it feel all the more special.
